title: Dataset Phenopacket Schema
description: An anonymous phenotypic description of an individual or biosample with potential genes of interest and/or diagnoses. The concept has multiple use-cases.

id.description: Unique, arbitrary, researcher-specified identifier for the phenopacket.
A unique researcher-specified identifier for an individual.

items.description: One of possibly many alternative identifiers for an individual.

alternateIds.description: A list of alternative identifiers for an individual.

dateOfBirth.description: A timestamp representing an individual's date of birth; either exactly or imprecisely.

sex.description: The phenotypic sex of an individual, as would be determined by a midwife or physician at birth.

karyotypicSex.description: The karyotypic sex of an individual.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

taxonomy.description: An ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

subject.description: A subject of a phenopacket, representing either a human (typically) or another organism.

description.description: Human-readable text describing the phenotypic feature; NOT for structured text.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term which describes the phenotype.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term which describes the phenotype.

type.description: An ontology term which describes the phenotype.

negated.description: Whether the feature is present (false) or absent (true, feature is negated); default is false.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

severity.description: An ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that expounds on the phenotypic feature.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that expounds on the phenotypic feature.

items.description: An ontology term that expounds on the phenotypic feature.

modifier.description: A list of ontology terms that provide more expressive / precise descriptions of a phenotypic feature, including e.g. positionality or external factors.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

onset.description: An ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that represents the evidence type.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that represents the evidence type.

evidenceCode.description: An ontology term that represents the evidence type.

id.description: An application-specific identifier. It is RECOMMENDED that this is a CURIE that uniquely identifies the evidence source when combined with a resource; e.g. PMID:123456 with a resource `pmid`. It could also be a URI or other relevant identifier.

reference.description: An encoding of information about a reference to an external resource.

evidence.description: One or more pieces of evidence that specify how the phenotype was determined.

items.description: A description of a phenotype that characterizes the proband of a Phenopacket.

phenotypicFeatures.description: A list of phenotypic features observed in the proband.

id.description: Unique arbitrary, researcher-specified identifier for the biosample.

individualId.description: Identifier for the individual this biosample was sampled from.

description.description: Human-readable, unstructured text describing the biosample or providing additional information.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term describing the tissue from which the specimen was collected. The use of UBERON is recommended.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term describing the tissue from which the specimen was collected. The use of UBERON is recommended.

sampledTissue.description: An ontology term describing the tissue from which the specimen was collected. The use of UBERON is recommended.

description.description: Human-readable text describing the phenotypic feature; NOT for structured text.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term which describes the phenotype.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term which describes the phenotype.

type.description: An ontology term which describes the phenotype.

negated.description: Whether the feature is present (false) or absent (true, feature is negated); default is false.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

severity.description: An ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that expounds on the phenotypic feature.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that expounds on the phenotypic feature.

items.description: An ontology term that expounds on the phenotypic feature.

modifier.description: A list of ontology terms that provide more expressive / precise descriptions of a phenotypic feature, including e.g. positionality or external factors.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

onset.description: An ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that represents the evidence type.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that represents the evidence type.

evidenceCode.description: An ontology term that represents the evidence type.

id.description: An application-specific identifier. It is RECOMMENDED that this is a CURIE that uniquely identifies the evidence source when combined with a resource; e.g. PMID:123456 with a resource `pmid`. It could also be a URI or other relevant identifier.

reference.description: An encoding of information about a reference to an external resource.

evidence.description: One or more pieces of evidence that specify how the phenotype was determined.

items.description: A description of a phenotype that characterizes a biosample of a Phenopacket.

phenotypicFeatures.description: A list of phenotypic features / abnormalities of the sample.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

taxonomy.description: An ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

age.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

oneOf.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

age.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

start.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.
start.help: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

age.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

end.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.
end.help: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

oneOf.description: Age range (e.g. when a subject's age falls into a bin)

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term representing a refinement of the clinical diagnosis. Normal samples could be tagged with NCIT:C38757, representing a negative finding.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term representing a refinement of the clinical diagnosis. Normal samples could be tagged with NCIT:C38757, representing a negative finding.

histologicalDiagnosis.description: An ontology term representing a refinement of the clinical diagnosis. Normal samples could be tagged with NCIT:C38757, representing a negative finding.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term representing if the specimen is from a primary tumour, a metastasis, or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen will have a specific meaning that is application specific..

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term representing if the specimen is from a primary tumour, a metastasis, or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen will have a specific meaning that is application specific..

tumorProgression.description: An ontology term representing if the specimen is from a primary tumour, a metastasis, or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen will have a specific meaning that is application specific..

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term representing the tumour grade. This should be a child term of NCIT:C28076 (Disease Grade Qualifier) or equivalent.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term representing the tumour grade. This should be a child term of NCIT:C28076 (Disease Grade Qualifier) or equivalent.

tumorGrade.description: An ontology term representing the tumour grade. This should be a child term of NCIT:C28076 (Disease Grade Qualifier) or equivalent.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term representing a clinically-relevant bio-marker. Most of the assays, such as immunohistochemistry (IHC), are covered by the NCIT ontology under the sub-hierarchy NCIT:C25294 (Laboratory Procedure), e.g. NCIT:C68748 (HER2/Neu Positive), or NCIT:C131711 Human Papillomavirus-18 Positive)..

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term representing a clinically-relevant bio-marker. Most of the assays, such as immunohistochemistry (IHC), are covered by the NCIT ontology under the sub-hierarchy NCIT:C25294 (Laboratory Procedure), e.g. NCIT:C68748 (HER2/Neu Positive), or NCIT:C131711 Human Papillomavirus-18 Positive)..

items.description: An ontology term representing a clinically-relevant bio-marker. Most of the assays, such as immunohistochemistry (IHC), are covered by the NCIT ontology under the sub-hierarchy NCIT:C25294 (Laboratory Procedure), e.g. NCIT:C68748 (HER2/Neu Positive), or NCIT:C131711 Human Papillomavirus-18 Positive)..

diagnosticMarkers.description: A list of ontology terms representing clinically-relevant bio-markers.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that represents a clinical procedure performed on a subject.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that represents a clinical procedure performed on a subject.

code.description: An ontology term that represents a clinical procedure performed on a subject.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that is specified when it is not possible to represent the procedure with a single ontology class.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that is specified when it is not possible to represent the procedure with a single ontology class.

bodySite.description: An ontology term that is specified when it is not possible to represent the procedure with a single ontology class.

procedure.description: A description of a clinical procedure performed on a subject in order to extract a biosample.

uri.description: A valid URI to the file

htsFormat.description: The file's format; one of SAM, BAM, CRAM, VCF, BCF, GVCF, FASTQ, or UNKNOWN.

genomeAssembly.description: Genome assembly ID for the file, e.g. GRCh38.

individualToSampleIdentifiers.description: Mapping between individual or biosample IDs and the sample identifier in the HTS file.

items.description: A link to a High-Throughput Sequencing (HTS) data file.

htsFiles.description: A list of HTS files derived from the biosample.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term taken from the Genotype Ontology (GENO) representing the zygosity of the variant.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term taken from the Genotype Ontology (GENO) representing the zygosity of the variant.

zygosity.description: An ontology term taken from the Genotype Ontology (GENO) representing the zygosity of the variant.

items.description: A representation used to describe candidate or diagnosed causative variants.

variants.description: A list of variants determined to be present in the biosample.

isControlSample.description: Whether the sample is being used as a normal control.

items.description: A unit of biological material from which the substrate molecules (e.g. genomic DNA, RNA, proteins) for molecular analyses are extracted, e.g. a tissue biopsy. Biosamples may be shared among several technical replicates or types of experiments.

biosamples.description: Samples (e.g. biopsies) taken from the individual, if any.

id.description: Official identifier of the gene. It SHOULD be a CURIE identifier with a prefix used by the official organism gene nomenclature committee, e.g. HGNC:347 for humans.

items.description: An alternative identifier from a resource where the gene is used or catalogued.

alternateIds.description: A list of identifiers for alternative resources where the gene is used or catalogued.

symbol.description: A gene's official gene symbol as designated by the organism's gene nomenclature committee, e.g. ETF1 from the HUGO Gene Nomenclature committee.

items.description: A representation of an identifier for a gene.

genes.description: Genes deemed to be relevant to the case; application-specific.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term taken from the Genotype Ontology (GENO) representing the zygosity of the variant.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term taken from the Genotype Ontology (GENO) representing the zygosity of the variant.

zygosity.description: An ontology term taken from the Genotype Ontology (GENO) representing the zygosity of the variant.

items.description: A representation used to describe candidate or diagnosed causative variants.

variants.description: A list of variants identified in the proband.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that represents the disease. It's recommended that one of the OMIM, Orphanet, or MONDO ontologies is used for rare human diseases.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that represents the disease. It's recommended that one of the OMIM, Orphanet, or MONDO ontologies is used for rare human diseases.

term.description: An ontology term that represents the disease. It's recommended that one of the OMIM, Orphanet, or MONDO ontologies is used for rare human diseases.

age.description: An ISO8601 duration string (e.g. P40Y10M05D for 40 years, 10 months, 5 days) representing an age of a subject.

onset.description: A representation of the age of onset of the disease

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that represents the disease stage. Terms should be children of NCIT:C28108 (Disease Stage Qualifier) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that represents the disease stage. Terms should be children of NCIT:C28108 (Disease Stage Qualifier) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

items.description: An ontology term that represents the disease stage. Terms should be children of NCIT:C28108 (Disease Stage Qualifier) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

diseaseStage.description: A list of terms representing the disease stage. Elements should be derived from child terms of NCIT:C28108 (Disease Stage Qualifier) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

id.description: A CURIE-style identifier for an ontology term that represents the TNM score. Terms should be children of NCIT:C48232 (Cancer TNM Finding) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

label.description: A human readable class name for an ontology term that represents the TNM score. Terms should be children of NCIT:C48232 (Cancer TNM Finding) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

items.description: An ontology term that represents the TNM score. Terms should be children of NCIT:C48232 (Cancer TNM Finding) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

tnmFinding.description: A list of terms representing the tumour TNM score. Elements should be derived from child terms of NCIT:C48232 (Cancer TNM Finding) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

items.description: A representation of a diagnosis, i.e. an inference or hypothesis about the cause underlying the observed phenotypic abnormalities.

diseases.description: A list of diseases diagnosed in the proband.

uri.description: A valid URI to the file

htsFormat.description: The file's format; one of SAM, BAM, CRAM, VCF, BCF, GVCF, FASTQ, or UNKNOWN.

genomeAssembly.description: Genome assembly ID for the file, e.g. GRCh38.

individualToSampleIdentifiers.description: Mapping between individual or biosample IDs and the sample identifier in the HTS file.

items.description: A link to a High-Throughput Sequencing (HTS) data file.

htsFiles.description: A list of HTS files derived from the individual.

created.description: ISO8601 timestamp specifying when when this object was created.

createdBy.description: Name of the person who created the phenopacket.

submittedBy.description: Name of the person who submitted the phenopacket.

id.description: Unique researcher-specified identifier for the resource.

namespacePrefix.description: Prefix for objects from this resource. In the case of ontology resources, this should be the CURIE prefix.

url.description: Resource URL. In the case of ontologies, this should be an OBO or OWL file. Other resources should link to the official or top-level url.

version.description: The version of the resource or ontology used to make the annotation.

iriPrefix.description: The IRI prefix, when used with the namespace prefix and an object ID, should resolve the term or object from the resource in question.

items.description: A description of an external resource used for referencing an object.

resources.description: A list of resources or ontologies referenced in the phenopacket

timestamp.description: ISO8601 timestamp specifying when when this update occurred.

updatedBy.description: Information about the person/organization/network that performed the update.

comment.description: Free-text comment about the changes made and/or the reason for the update.

items.description: An update event for a record (e.g. a phenopacket.)

updates.description: A list of updates to the phenopacket.

phenopacketSchemaVersion.description: Schema version of the current phenopacket.

id.description: An application-specific identifier. It is RECOMMENDED that this is a CURIE that uniquely identifies the evidence source when combined with a resource; e.g. PMID:123456 with a resource `pmid`. It could also be a URI or other relevant identifier.

items.description: An encoding of information about a reference to an external resource.

metaData.description: A structured definition of the resources and ontologies used within a phenopacket.
